title: Ticket #2758: Enforce profile loading for Windows machines with dedicated user(s).
description:
[Assigned to ToddT for a priority decision. I think this could be completed very quickly, easily in time for 7.7.5, which would make us happy.]

Short version: Add a knob, probably named LOAD_PROFILE, that acts exactly like the submit-file attribute LoadProfile, but is machine- instead of job- specific.

Long version: I just wasted an hour discovering that doing builds in the new Lab rather requires this. I don't want any of my users having to go through the same trouble; instead, I'd like to be able, as the administrator, to make LoadProfile true. I can do this by changing Metronome or tweaking SUBMIT_EXPRS.

The former doesn't help other Condor users and the latter won't work for anyone who permits remote submissions.
remarks:
2012-Jan-13 12:54:02 by tannenba:
I am all about making BaTLab happy :)

Thoughts:

  1. TJ, what would be the downside(s) of running w/ Load Profile always on?

  2. If the user actually specifies a load profile preference in the job classad, we want that to have precedent over whatever some machine owner claims, right?

  3. Still not sure I want to special case load profile - essentially this is just an instance of a broader problem where we want to be able to specify default values for job classad attributes for any job that lands in our pool. Moreover, I am not sure I like the idea that this is at the startd level - seems like it should be more at the central manager level. What about the idea of a knob that is like the already existing NEGOTIATOR_MATCH_EXPRS knob, but instead of inserting attrs w/ a prefix, it inserts un-prefixed attrs into the job ads iff those attrs are not already specified? Maybe named something like NEGOTIATOR_DEFAULT_MATCH_EXPRS ?
